Brit mila: The covenantal circumcision performed on the eighth day of a Jewish boy’s life, symbolizing the covenant between God and Abraham’s descendants.
Zeved habat: A ceremony welcoming a newborn Jewish girl, marking her entry into the covenant and often including the naming of the child.
Pidyon haben: The redemption of a firstborn son by giving five silver coins to a kohen, commemorating the salvation of the Israelite firstborns in Egypt.
